session_info.name: WEKA - Keynote Talk: Selection of materials and processes for non-magnetic applications

papers.title: Selection of Materials and Processes for Vacuum, Cryogenic and Non-Magnetic Applications in Particle Accelerators
authors: Stringent requirements are placed on materials of modern accelerators. Their physical and mechanical properties
weldability or brazeability are key parameters. Adequate strength
magnetic properties at room as well as low temperatures are important factors for materials of accelerators working at cryogenic temperatures. In addition

NEG activation or submitted to the impact of the beam impose specific choices of material grades. Magnetic properties are of paramount importance. In order to minimize the magnetic permeability of the final components
precise specifications in terms of composition and microstructure have to be applied. Today

stainless steels are the dominant materials for accelerator construction. Their metallurgy is extensively treated. It will be shown that a stainless steel does not only consist of a chemical composition or a designation
but is the result of a whole metallurgy and metalworking process
in view of obtaining adequate purity
inclusion cleanliness and fineness of the microstructure. Innovative manufacturing and non-destructive examination technologies will also be covered.
